bill.title: Emerging Crops Fund; agribusiness engaging in poultry operations must have letter of commitment to be eligible for certain loans.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-2-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In Order For An Agribusiness Engaged In Poultry Production Operations To Be Eligible For Certain Loans Made By The Mississippi Development Authority From The Emerging Crops Fund, The Agribusiness Must Obtain A Written Letter Of Agreement Establishing A Commitment From A Poultry Company With Which The Agribusiness Contracts, That The Poultry Company Has Signed And Agrees To Comply With The Terms Of The Ten Point Agreement Made By The Governor's Special Poultry Committee As Agreed On November 19, 1996; To Provide That An Agribusiness Engaged In Poultry Production Operations Without A Written Letter Of Agreement Establishing A Commitment From A Poultry Company Shall Not Be Prohibited From Receiving Other Loans Applied For That Are Available To Agribusiness And Horticulture Enterprises; And For Related Purposes.
